text: Neufchâtel is a French cheese product from Neufchâtel-en-Bray, in Seine- Maritime, Normandy. It generally takes the form of a heart or a small brick. It has a salty taste, and a similar texture to Camembert cheese. It is made from unpasteurized cow's milk. This cheese is protected by an Appellation d'origine contrôlée - meaning that no other area can claim to make it. Category:French cheeses Category:Seine-Maritime
title: Neufchâtel
